thread.section_title: Arsene Wenger admits his Arsenal future is not completely sorted – Metro
thread.title: Arsene Wenger admits his Arsenal future is not completely sorted
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger admits his Arsenal future is not completely sorted

author: Coral Barry
title: Arsene Wenger admits his Arsenal future is not completely sorted
text:
Arsene Wenger did say after the West Brom game his announcement would be soon (Picture: Getty) Arsene Wenger has backtracked on comments he made after the West Brom defeat by revealing his future at Arsenal has not been completely decided.
Wenger fires warning to Chelsea over Sanchez pursuit The Arsenal boss has been under intense pressure to decide on whether he will sign a new deal and told reporters after the 3-1 loss to West Brom that he would announce his decision ‘very soon’.
But in his press conference on Thrusday ahead of Arsenal’s game against Manchester City, Wenger seemed to backtrack on his comments two weeks ago.
‘Not today,’ said Wenger when asked if he would announce his decision.
Arsenal fixtures Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 Apr
Manchester City (N) FA Cup – Sun 23 Apr
Tottenham (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Manchester United (H) – Sat 6 May
Stoke (A) – Sat 13 May
‘But I am very clear in my mind.
‘Do I stay two more years? My commitment will be the same.
‘It does not influence my attitude. I’ve always been clear in my mind.
Arsenal supporters have made their views known (Picture: Getty) ‘It’s a subject that is not sorted completely.’
Wenger has reportedly agreed to stay on a further two years at Arsenal despite fans launching protests against his reign.
‘Wenger Out’ banners have become a regular feature of Arsenal’s games with the Gunners currently sixth in the Premier League table.
Wenger and Arsenal play Manchester City on Sunday (Picture: Getty) More: Football Jose Mourinho speaks out over Man United's interest for 'absurd' £173m superstar 
Mourinho tells Manchester United talisman he'd be happy for him to leave 
Long-term Jurgen Klopp target decides which club he will join in the summer 
After the West Brom game Wenger said: ‘Don’t worry, I know what I will do in my future.
‘You will soon know.’
Asked how soon, Wenger replied: ‘Very soon.’
MORE: Arsene Wenger fires warning to Chelsea over Alexis Sanchez pursuit
